tit.j: 京都コンサートホール

sen.j: 京都コンサートホール（きょうと こんさーとほーる）は、京都市左京区に位置するクラシック音楽コンサート専用のホール。
sen.e: Located in Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Concert Hall is dedicated to classical music concerts.
Located in Sakyo Ward in Kyoto City, Kyoto Concert Hall is dedicated to classical music concerts.
Located in Sakyo Ward in Kyoto City, Kyoto Concert Hall is dedicated to classical music concerts.

sen.j: 平安京建都1200年記念事業の一環として京都市が建設、財団法人京都市音楽芸術文化振興財団が管理・運営する。
sen.e: It was built by Kyoto City as the 1200th anniversary of the establishment of Heiankyo, and is operated by Kyoto City Music Art Cultural Promoting Foundation.
It was built by Kyoto City on the 1200th anniversary of the establishment of Heiankyo, and is operated by Kyoto City Music Art Cultural Promoting Foundation.
sen.cmt: 「as」→「on」. Who exactly was it built by? It may be better to add "Government' after 'Kyoto City' or be precise about which institution organised the building of the concert hall.
sen.e: It was built by Kyoto City on the 1200th anniversary of the establishment of Heiankyo, and is operated by Kyoto City Music Art Cultural Promoting Foundation.

sen.j: シューボックス型の大ホールにパイプオルガンが設置されている。
sen.e: An pipe organ is installed in its shoe box-shaped main hall.
An pipe organ is installed in its shoe box-shaped main hall.
An pipe organ is installed in its shoe box-shaped main hall.

sen.j: 京都市交響楽団の本拠地。
sen.e: It is Kyoto Symphony Orchestra's home music hall.
It is Kyoto Symphony Orchestra's home music hall.
It is Kyoto Symphony Orchestra's home music hall.
Completed in 1995.
Completed in 1995.
Completed in 1995.

sen.j: 設計は磯崎新。
sen.e: Designed by Arata ISOZAKI.
Designed by Arata ISOZAKI.
Designed by Arata ISOZAKI.

sen.j: 現在の館長は廣瀬量平。
sen.e: The current director of the hall is Ryohei HIROSE.
The current director of the hall is Ryohei HIROSE.
The current director of the hall is Ryohei HIROSE.

sen.j: 特徴
sen.e: Features
Features
Features

sen.j: 表通りからエントランスに引き込まれるような池沿いの導入路、大小ホールに上昇する螺旋状のスロープなど、全体にアプローチ動線が長めに設定されている。
sen.e: Its passage ways are designed to be rather long: its approach path along a pond from the street feels like drawn into the entrance; spiral slopes lead to its large and small halls.

Its passageways are designed to be rather long: the path from the main street to approach the hall passes a pond and gives the visitor a feeling of being drawn into the entrance; spiral slopes lead to its large and small halls.

Its passageways are designed to be rather long: the path from the main street to approach the hall passes a pond and gives the visitor a feeling of being drawn into the entrance; spiral slopes lead to its large and small halls.

sen.j: これは京都の社寺空間にならったもので、同時にコンサートへの期待を高めるための空間演出といわれている。
sen.e: This was modeled after temples and shrines in Kyoto, and it is said to uplift the spirits of the audience as well.
This was modeled after temples and shrines in Kyoto, and it is said to uplift the spirits of the audience as well.
This was modeled after temples and shrines in Kyoto, and it is said to uplift the spirits of the audience as well.

sen.j: 足腰の弱い人は、エレベータでホール階に直行できる。
sen.e: Elevators also take the disabled to each floor of the halls.
Elevators also take the disabled to each floor of the halls.
Elevators also take the disabled to each floor of the halls.

sen.j: オルガンは日本の伝統楽器を含んだ世界初のストップが好評である。
sen.e: Its world's first stops that include tones of Japanese traditional instruments are very popular.
The world's first organ stops which include tones from Japanese traditional instruments are very popular.
sen.cmt: The term 'stop' may need explaining as it may not be familiar to people outside the field of music.「Its」→「The」, 「organ」挿入,「that」→「which」, 「of」→「from」
sen.e: The world's first organ stops which include tones from Japanese traditional instruments are very popular.

sen.j: 施設概要
sen.e: Summary of the facility
Summary of facilities
Summary of Facilities
sen.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 敷地面積 9,900m2 延床面積 22,412m2
sen.e: Site area: 9,900 m2; total floor space: 22,412 m2
Site area: 9,900 m2; total floor space: 22,412 m2
Site area: 9,900 square meters; total floor space: 22,412 square meters

sen.j: 大ホール
sen.e: The large hall
The large hall
The large hall

sen.j: 1839席（うち車椅子席6） 3階席まで
sen.e: 1839 seats (including six for wheelchairs), up to the third floor balcony seats
1839 seats (including six for wheelchairs), up to the third floor balcony seats
1839 seats (including six for wheelchairs), up to the third floor balcony seats

sen.j: パイプオルガンは総ストップ数90、パイプ総数7,155本。
sen.e: Pipe organ: 90 stops in total, 7155 pipes in total
Pipe organ: 90 stops in total, 7155 pipes in total
Pipe organ: 90 stops in total, 7155 pipes in total.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせピリオドを追加

sen.j: ドイツ・ヨハネスクライス社製。
sen.e: Made by Johannes Klais Orgelbau GmbH & Co. KG, Germany.
Made by Johannes Klais Orgelbau GmbH & Co. KG, Germany.
Made by Johannes Klais Orgelbau GmbH & Co. KG, Germany.

sen.j: シューボックス型。
sen.e: Shoe-box type
Shoe-box type
Shoe-box type.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせピリオドを追加

sen.j: 平行壁面にランダムな凹凸溝を配置し、天井に不規則な突起物を配置することによって、音の拡散を図っている。
sen.e: This hall scatters sounds with randomly corrugated surface on the parallel side walls and irregular projections on the ceiling.
The hall scatters sound using randomly corrugated surfaces on the parallel side walls and irregular projections on the ceiling.
The hall scatters sound using randomly corrugated surfaces on the parallel side walls and irregular projections on the ceiling.

sen.j: 音響設計は永田音響設計。
sen.e: Its acoustic design was made by Nagata Acoustics.
Its acoustic design was made by Nagata Acoustics.
Its acoustic design was made by Nagata Acoustics.

sen.j: アンサンブルホールムラタ（小ホール）
sen.e: Ensemble Hall Murata (the small hall)
sen.cmt: アンサンブルホールムラタ→Ensemble Hall Murata(アンサンブルホールムラタ）[定訳不明]
sen.e: Ensemble Hall Murata (the small hall)
Ensemble Hall Murata (the small hall)

sen.j: 514席（うち車椅子席4）
sen.e: 514 seats (including four for wheelchairs)
514 seats (including four for wheelchairs)
514 seats (including four for wheelchairs)

sen.j: 所在地
sen.e: Location
Location
Location

sen.j: 京都市左京区下鴨半木町1-26
sen.e: Shimogamohangi Cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City
Shimogamohangi Cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City
1-26 Hangi-cho, Shimogamo, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄烏丸線北山駅から徒歩約3分
sen.e: Approximately three minutes on foot from Kitayama Station of Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line.
Approximately three minutes on foot from Kitayama Station on the Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line.
Approximately three minutes on foot from Kitayama Station on the Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line
